chapter.title: The Command-Line-Runner
chapter.para: If you have a configuration file named phpbu.xml in your current working directory you can execute phpbu like this
chapter.screen:
phpbu phpbu 3.0.0
Configuration read from /some/path/phpbu.xml
OK (1 backup, 0 checks, 0 encryption, 0 syncs, 0 cleanups)
chapter.para: If you want to use a custom name for your configuration file you have to use the --configuration option.
chapter.screen:
phpbu --configuration=MyConfig.xml phpbu 3.0.0
Configuration read from /some/path/MyConfig.xml
OK (1 backup, 0 checks, 0 encryption, 0 syncs, 0 cleanups)

section.title: Command-Line-Runner options
section.para: Here is the list of available options for the command line runner.
section.screen:
$ phpbu --help phpbu 3.0.0
Usage: phpbu [option]
--bootstrap=<file> A "bootstrap" PHP file that is included before the backup. --configuration=<file> A phpbu xml config file. --colors Use colors in output. --debug Display debugging information during backup generation. --simulate Shows what phpbu would do without actually executing anything. -h, --help Prints this usage information. -v, --verbose Output more verbose information. -V, --version Output version information and exit.

listitem.para: A "bootstrap" PHP file that is included before executing the backup.

section.title: Simulation
section.para: In order to test phpbu, phpbu supports a simulation mode where no backup is actually created and no sync and cleanup tasks are executed. In simulation phpbu will show you what it would have done if this would not have been a simulation run. You will get some output so you can track every action phpbu would have performed.
This is a great way of testing if all the right backups will be cleaned up. And if the correct backup commands will be executed.

caution.title: Warning
caution.para: If you are using any kind of credentials for example for MySQL to authenticate on the command line, this credentials will maybe shown in the simulation debug information.

section.para: If you are extending phpbu you can support simulation as well. You can find more detailed information on this in .
